title: Geth 1.10.23 fresh sync is broken for Post-Merge networks with error: Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates.
body:
#### System information

Geth version:
```
Version: 1.10.23-stable
Git Commit: d901d85377c2c2f05f09f423c7d739c0feecd90a
Git Commit Date: 20220824
Architecture: arm64
Go Version: go1.18.5
Operating System: linux
```
Prysm beacon-chain version:
```
beacon-chain version Prysm/v3.1.1/653ea3b030c3bb99aa3f3d95a8de9f4d6e147930. Built at: 2022-09-09 17:24:18+00:00
```

#### Expected behaviour
We expect system should start syncing from scratch both for Geth and Prysm beacon clients


#### Actual behaviour
Prysm is syncing: [log1](https://gist.github.com/begetan/ea935fe9c26a4a269d7458b0cfec37eb)
Geth is not able to sync: [log2](https://gist.github.com/begetan/10733dbd611fb85da61030677d2f315e)

Geth not able to sync with this error message:
`Beacon client online, but never received consensus updates. Please ensure your beacon client is operational to follow the chain!` 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. Configure geth with systemd unit
2. Configure prysm with systemd unit
3. Create jwt token
3. Start services:
```
systemctl enable geth.service --now
systemctl enable prysm.service --now

```
This issue is not fully repeatable. It may depend on the startup timings.
It occurs at  90% tries of deployment of Goerli and 50% of Ropsten deploynment. Mainnet is not affected at the moment, because this check is in Post-Merge code.

Another important thing, get in this status provides incorrect sync state:

```
curl -s -X POST -H "Content-Type:application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_syncing","id":1}' localhost:8545
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":false}

du -shc /data/*
2.2M    /data/geth
4.0K    /data/jwtsecret
325M    /data/prysm
327M    total
```
You can see that geth data directory is empty at the moment of syncing=false report.  We didn't success to recover geth from dead-loop by restarting geth of prysm services. The only way to recover this situation is to replace geth with binary version 1.10.21
